author: babybus
title: #49 Nagasaki defiende su decisi√≥n de no invitar a Israel al memorial conmemorativo de la bomba at√≥mica (EN)
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
[#1](c1#c-1) Invitar a EEUU es de guasa, ¬øhan pedido perd√≥n en alg√∫n momento despu√©s de la burrada que hicieron?
[#21](c21#c-21) Yo dir√≠a que por decencia moral. Nagasaki era totalmente innecesario. S√≥lo fue una prueba de campo y una "advertencia" a los vecinos del Norte (curiosamente aliados en aquellas fechas) sobre la inviolabilidad de Hokkaido. Que los japoneses eran m√°s malos que la ti√±a, pero cargarse 100000 para dar una advertencia...
[#24](c24#c-24) Ya se hab√≠an cargado otros tantos en los bombardeos de tokio.
https://historia.nationalgeographic.com.es/a/el-bombardeo-de-tokio-uno-de-los-mas-mortiferos-de-la-historia_15135
Solo cambia el medio utilizado.
[#35](c35#c-35) Eso no puede ser cierto, ya que es un hecho que ha sucedido. No puedes decir que algo que ha pasado no tiene ninguna raz√≥n para pasar.
[#42](c42#c-42) Yo no tengo una opini√≥n sobre esos hechos. Hace mucho tiempo y la moral ha cambiado mucho desde entonces. Adem√°s, la segunda guerra mundial es un contexto hist√≥rico muy espec√≠fico.
Obviamente, yo hoy no aprobar√≠a moralmente el lanzamiento de bombas at√≥micas sobre nadie.
[#3](c3#c-3) Bueno, podr√≠amos decir que los propios japoneses no fueron de lo m√°s delicado con sus v√≠ctimas en Manchuria. Aqu√≠ no se libra nadie.
[#3](c3#c-3) Al igual que los japoneses son invitados al monumento al Arizona desde hace d√©cadas. De eso se trata cuando se habla de cerrar heridas y pasar p√°gina. Entre otras cosas porque las generaciones de entonces no son las de ahora. La mayor√≠a de ceremonias conjuntas datan de los '60 y USA y jap√≥n son aliados hace mucho.
As√≠ que lo que me parece de guasa es tu comentario que est√° obviando 60 a√±os de historia por un poco de karma f√°cil.
[#39](c39#c-39) Criticar que EEUU atacase con bombas at√≥micas a poblaci√≥n civil no es por karma, es por estar en contra de cr√≠menes de guerra
Me parece precioso el gesto y puede parecer vac√≠o, pero a fin de cuestas nuestra realidad se basa en gestos vac√≠os sin grandes aspavientos y grandes acciones que nos definen como buenas o malas personas.
As√≠ que me parece precioso que no se permita a unas personas que est√°n cometiendo un genocidio ahora mismo a que asistan a los actos de recordatorio de un crimen de guerra horrendo, como fueron el lanzamiento de dos bombas at√≥micos sobre unas ciudades por parte de USA.
Y si USA se cree que su ausencia hace de menos a esta conmemoraci√≥n est√° muy equivocada, son ellos los que se convierten en menos por no asistir...
Y lo mismo digo a Francia (que ya est√° tirada por el suelo por no expulsar a Israel de los juegos) o Reino Unido...
Han quedado a la altura de lo que son ahora mismo...
La nada m√°s terrible.
The British embassy said leaving out Israel created ‚Äúan unfortunate and misleading equivalency with Russia and Belarus ‚Äî the only other countries not invited to this year‚Äôs ceremony‚Äù
Desde luego que es una desafortunada equivalencia. Rusia no esta haciendo un genocidio especialmente enfocado a ni√±os.
Israel‚Äôs exclusion had ‚Äúpoliticized‚Äù the event.
No reventaran, porque claro, una guerra, una bomba nuclear de un estado enemigo y una reunion por ese evento con politicos de todos los paises no es politizar algo. Hijos de puta no reventaran.
Otro circo m√°s para proyectar imagen a nivel internacional, pero ya est√° todo m√°s que hablado de antes. Estas cosas a mi me parecen pr√°cticamente prensa rosa venida a mas.
Ahora mismo apoyar abiertamente el genocidio israel√≠ no beneficiaria a Jap√≥n, invitando a EEUU ya han expresado su postura diplom√°tica y han cumplido con sus obligaciones en cuanto a imagen internacional.
Por otro lado EEUU tambi√©n debe mantener su imagen de apoyo incondicional a Israel.
Los tratos comerciales, que es lo que manda, no se van a ver afectados por esto.
Jap√≥n se mantiene como aliado incondicional de EEUU igual que lleva siendo los √∫ltimos 80 a√±os.
Ya no es por una cuesti√≥n num√©rica. Israel no puede ser invitada a nada, m√°s que a detener el aberrante genocidio contra el pueblo palestino.
EEUU, UK y otros pa√≠ses demostrando que hay v√≠ctimas civiles que valen y otra que no. Y todo para apoyar a un estado genocida, en pleno genocidio de civiles inocentes.
Por eso nunca ha pasado nada con los m√°s de 160 millones de muertos en la India, de las decenas de miles en Iraq y tantos otros m√°s en tantos otros pa√≠ses.
Porque se las sudan.
Por cierto, en RU hay un nuevo PM... otra prueba m√°s que los laboristas actuales (como los de blair) son la misma mierda que los conservadores.

author: JOVANA GEC
title: Serbian police ban cultural festival with Kosovo as pressure mounts on liberal voices
text:
Serbian police on Thursday banned a festival that promotes cultural exchange with Kosovo in a sign of growing nationalism and government pressure on liberal voices in the Balkan country.
A police statement cited security concerns as the reason to ban the Mirdita, dobar dan event that was due to start later on Thursday in Belgrade with a theater show from Kosovo.
Serbia does not recognize the 2008 declaration of independence by its former province, which is overwhelmingly ethnic Albanian. The Mirdita, dobar dan festival, whose name means ‚Äúhello‚Äù in Albanian and Serbian, is organized by youth groups from Serbia and Kosovo seeking to bridge ethnic divisions created by a 1998-99 war and the postwar tensions.
Organizers in Serbia, the Youth Initiative for Human Rights group, said that Serbian police violated the country's constitution, its own and European laws: ‚ÄúIt is a basic duty of the state to secure the rights and freedoms guaranteed by the law and to sanction all those who limit or violate those freedoms and citizens' rights.‚Äù
The group added that police did not allow the bus with participants to enter Belgrade and ordered that it return to Kosovo under police escort.
The police ban came after several dozen right-wing extremists gathered outside the festival venue on Thursday, seeking to prevent its holding while waving Serbian flags. Police said they wanted to prevent ‚Äúdanger to the security of people and property and to public peace and order on a larger scale.‚Äù
A statement said that the anti-festival gathering is also banned.
Liberal groups criticized the police decision.
‚ÄúWith the ban on ‚ÄòMirdita,‚Äô Serbia and its institutions sided with the hooligans and the deepest ethno-nationalist darkness,‚Äù prominent human rights activist Natasa Kandic said on X. ‚ÄúNo longer can a debate about reconciliation or a protest against glorification of war criminals be organized in Serbia. A black hole.‚Äù
The Movement of Free Citizens party urged the Interior Ministry to revoke the ban also saying the authorities have sided with the extremists who are opposed to regional reconciliation.
Several government officials have sharply criticized the festival in the past several days, describing it as anti-Serb. While the festival has been held alternatively in Serbia and Kosovo for the past decade, this year's ban in Serbia illustrates a general toughening of the government's stance toward its critics.
Earlier this week, authorities banned a Bosnian actor and author from entering Serbia, saying he was a threat to national security, and deported him back to Sarajevo, Bosnia's capital. In the past months, Serbia's independent and investigative journalists have complained of increased legal pressure and threats.
Serbia is formally seeking entry into the European Union but the increasingly authoritarian government of populist President Aleksandar Vucic has steadily drifted away from the EU's pro-democracy values while nurturing close ties with Russia and China.

organizations.name: youth initiative for human rights group

author: JNS
title: Not what Jesus taught
text:
They are an ‚Äúexpression of an empire of evil that emanates from Tehran,‚Äù the Israeli president told Christian leaders at a holiday gathering.
Israeli President Isaac Herzog told Christian leaders that the massacre carried out by Hamas on Oct. 7 is incompatible with the teaching of Jesus and the basic tenets of the Jewish faith as well as moderate Islam.
‚ÄúEvil forces of the worst kind carried out a barbaric, sadistic attack, killing innocent women, children, old people, young people, people from 40 nationalities, taking hostages, raping, chopping heads, burning people and more,‚Äù Herzog said at a meeting with Christian leaders in the Holy Land on Thursday at the President‚Äôs Residence in Jerusalem ahead of Christmas.
‚ÄúNothing of this is compatible with the Gospels, with the writing of the Gospels, with the teaching of Jesus Christ, or the teachings of course of the Jewish faith, and also with moderate Islam,‚Äù he said.
‚ÄúOur problem‚Äîall of us‚Äîis with extreme fundamentalist Islam, which does not accommodate you or us. It‚Äôs an expression of an empire of evil that emanates from Tehran, which believes in jihadist ideology, which we all have to eradicate. And that is why this war was forced upon us,‚Äù Herzog said.
Greek Patriarch Theophilos III, the head of the Orthodox Church of Jerusalem, said at the holiday reception, ‚ÄúOur common moral tradition teaches the unique value of every human life and respect for the dignity of every person.
‚ÄúOur common moral tradition expects the entire human family to live in dignity. Our common moral tradition recognizes the importance of freedom, safety and security for the well-being of all,‚Äù Theophilos said.

author: brielle.
title: sempre meno fumatori nell\u2019Hauts-de-France, risultato di anni di consapevolezza
text: [France](/tag/France), risultato di anni di consapevolezza Per il nono anno, Sant√© Publique [France](/tag/France) e il Ministero della Salute propongono un ‚Äúmese senza tabacco‚Äù per sensibilizzare i francesi sui pericoli delle sigarette e incoraggiare i fumatori a smettere di fumare. E se l‚ÄôHauts-de-France conta pi√π fumatori della media nazionale, da quindici anni la regione registra un forte calo dei consumatori giornalieri. Azienda Dalla vita quotidiana alle grandi questioni, scopri i temi che compongono la societ√† locale, come la giustizia, l‚Äôistruzione, la salute e la famiglia. France T√©l√©visions utilizza il tuo indirizzo email per inviarti la newsletter ‚ÄúSociet√†‚Äù. Potrai cancellarti in ogni momento tramite il link in fondo a questa newsletter. La nostra politica sulla privacy Aiutare qualcuno a smettere di fumare richiede pazienza e molto insegnamento. Ne sa qualcosa Am√©lie Sueur, infermiera del tabacco presso il centro ospedaliero di Abbeville. ‚ÄúCi sono ancora molte idee preconcette sul tabacconota. Ad esempio, quando vuoi smettere, non dovresti interessarti solo al numero di sigarette consumate al giorno, ma anche al tipo di tabacco. Una sigaretta arrotolata equivale a due o tre sigarette industriali. Quindi dire che fumiamo dieci sigarette al giorno non significa molto. Questo √® il motivo per cui spesso sottovalutiamo il dosaggio necessario per il sostituto della nicotina..‚Äù Trasmette queste informazioni ogni giorno ai suoi pazienti, ma anche a un pubblico pi√π ampio durante il mese senza tabacco. Questa operazione di sanit√† pubblica, rinnovata ogni anno dal 2016, mira a intensificare la lotta al fumo. L‚Äôanno scorso si sono iscritti pi√π di 16.000 abitanti dell‚ÄôHauts-de-France: √® una delle regioni che segue di pi√π l‚Äôoperazione. Quest‚Äôanno, per l‚Äôoccasione, √® stato allestito uno stand presso la reception dell‚Äôospedale di Abbeville, con documentazione e kit di aiuto per smettere di fumare. Una volta alla settimana, sono a disposizione anche medici e infermieri specializzati nel settore del tabacco per incoraggiare il dibattito. ‚ÄúAlcuni vengono spontanei a fare domande allo stand, a volte andiamo direttamente nel piazzale antistante l‚Äôospedale per avvicinarci ai fumatori, per parlare con loro in completo relax del loro consumo di tabacco.spiega Am√©lie Sueur. Spesso all‚Äôinizio c‚Äô√® un po‚Äô di apprensione, hanno paura di essere presi di mira. Ma l‚Äôidea non √® affatto quella di sentirsi in colpa. √à molto importante spiegare loro che non √® solo una questione di volont√†.‚Äú Quanto prima si inizia, e soprattutto quando il cervello non √® ancora completamente sviluppato, tanto pi√π √® probabile che si diventi altamente dipendenti. Am√©lie Sueur, infermiera del tabacco La moltiplicazione di questo tipo di interventi di prevenzione del fumo sembra dare i suoi frutti. Nell‚ÄôHauts-de-France, che fino a poco tempo fa occupava il secondo posto sul podio delle regioni dove si fuma di pi√π, negli ultimi anni abbiamo assistito a una diminuzione significativa del numero di fumatori. Tra il 2017 e il 2021, il tasso giornaliero di fumatori √® sceso dal 30,8% al 26,4%. Consapevolezza che sembra funzionare soprattutto sui pi√π giovani: iL‚ÄôOsservatorio francese delle droghe e delle tendenze alle dipendenze rileva una tendenza al ribasso nel consumo di tabacco tra gli adolescenti. Un punto molto importante, perch√© l‚Äôet√† ha un impatto sulla dipendenza. ‚ÄúPrima iniziamo, e soprattutto quando il cervello non √® ancora completamente sviluppato, maggiore √® la probabilit√† che diventiamo altamente dipendenti‚Äú, indica l‚Äôinfermiera. Ma se la soluzione migliore per proteggersi dai danni del tabacco √® non iniziare, √® del tutto possibile rinunciare alle sigarette, anche dopo anni di consumo. Per Am√©lie Sueur, decifrare il processo che crea la dipendenza √® essenziale per iniziare un‚Äôastinenza efficace. ‚ÄúIl primo consiglio √® cercare di capire come funziona. Quando fumi, la nicotina arriva in un colpo, arriva al cervello in sette secondi, specifica. La nicotina influenzer√† il sistema di ricompensa e il Il cervello riconoscer√† questa sostanza come qualcosa di essenziale per il suo corretto funzionamento.‚Äú√à per questo motivo che raccomanda l‚Äôuso di sostituti della nicotina, come i cerotti, che diffondono continuamente la sostanza nel corpo e aiutano a disabituare il cervello alla nicotina. Un fumatore non diventa mai un non fumatore, sar√† un ex fumatore. Il suo cervello manterr√† l‚Äôappetito per la nicotina. Am√©lie Sueur, infermiera del tabacco D‚Äôaltro canto non √® da sottovalutare il rischio di recidiva. ‚ÄúMettiamo a dormire i recettori della nicotina nel cervello, e loro possono rimanere addormentati fino alla fine della loro vita, ma non dovresti mai pi√π fumare, perch√© sveglierai questi recettori, che riconosceranno immediatamente la sostanza. √à un po‚Äô come l‚Äôalcol, una volta svezzato, corri un grosso rischio se bevi di nuovoassicura l‚Äôinfermiera. Un fumatore non diventa mai un non fumatore, √® un ex fumatore. Il suo cervello manterr√† l‚Äôappetito per la nicotina.‚Äù Secondo gli ultimi dati di Public Health France, nel 2021, quasi 6 fumatori giornalieri su 10 hanno espresso il desiderio di smettere e poco pi√π di un quarto ha provato a smettere durante l‚Äôanno. Anche se prima √®, meglio √®, non √® mai troppo tardi per smettere di fumare. ‚ÄúGli anziani che smettono di fumare riscontrano, dopo un anno, un rischio di ictus equivalente a quello dei non fumatori, con un rischio di infarto miocardico dimezzato.‚Äú, sottolinea la Federazione francese di cardiologia. Smettere di fumare aiuta anche a ridurre il rischio di sviluppare il cancro ai polmoni o la BPCO (broncopneumopatia cronica ostruttiva). √à stato curando pazienti in riabilitazione cardiorespiratoria che Am√©lie Sueur ha scelto di specializzarsi in tabaccologia. ‚ÄúHo visto il danno che ha fatto‚Äú, confida. Ogni anno, il fumo provoca 75.000 morti all‚Äôanno, di cui 9.000 nell‚ÄôHauts-de-France. Per aiutarti a smettere di fumare, non esitare a chiamare il 3989 o visitare il sito web del Mese senza tabacco. Con Narjis El Asraoui / FTV

author: Reuters
title: Ukraine ammunition drive raises enough to buy first 300,000 shells, Czech PM says
text:
Adds Czech president's previous comments, adviser and pledges from EU countries in paragraphs 3-9
PRAGUE, March 8 (Reuters) - The Czech-led initiative to buy ammunition for Ukraine as it battles Russia's invasion has raised enough so far to purchase a first batch of 300,000 artillery shells, Czech Prime Minister Petr Fiala said on X social media platform on Friday.
"Our goal is to deliver much more!" he said. "Our work and our help to Ukraine do not end here. We keep seeking partners so that we can continue to support Ukraine in its brave fight against the Russian aggressor."
Czech President Petr Pavel had said on Thursday the initiative had collected the amount needed for acquiring 800,000 ammunition pieces that had earlier been found and were available from unspecified countries outside Europe.
A government adviser was quoted as saying in Czech media on Thursday evening, after Pavel had spoken of secured financing, that the full purchase was still not covered and there was no target amount in the initiative.
Pavel had last month said 500,000 rounds of 155-calibre ammunition and 300,000 rounds of 122-calibre ammunition were available and could be delivered with secured funding.
Several European Union members and countries outside the bloc have made pledges to the ammunition drive for Ukraine, as fighting against Russia's full-scale invasion hits a third year.
It comes as the EU will miss a year-old target to deliver one million ammunition rounds to Ukraine this month and as U.S. military aid, which has been the backbone of international support for Kyiv, has stalled.
Norway said on Thursday it would donate up to 1.6 billion Norwegian crowns ($153 million) for the Czech plan. That followed pledges by Germany and France this week.
Pavel said on Thursday that 18 countries had joined the initiative.
(Reporting by Jason Hovet; Editing by Mark Potter and Emelia Sithole-Matarise)

author: Speedway Digest Staff
title: Bass Pro Shops and Martin Truex Jr.Reunite For 2025 Daytona 500
text:
Bass Pro Shops and Martin Truex Jr.Reunite For 2025 Daytona 500
Bass Pro Shops announced today that it will be the primary sponsor for longtime partner Martin Truex Jr. for the 67th running of the Daytona 500 on Feb. 16. Daytona will reunite the winning team that has been together since 2001 and included such career highlights for Truex as the 2017 Cup Series championship, the 2017 and 2023 Cup Series regular-season championships and the 2004 and 2005 Busch Series championships. His 34 race victories over a 21-year career include the 2016 and 2019 Coca-Cola 600 and the 2016 Southern 500. ‚ÄúWe are fired up to be back with Martin again‚Ä¶
Read more at Speedway Digest - Home for NASCAR News

author: WIL COURTNEY Staff Reporter
title: Adults hunt Easter eggs for Boy Scouts
text:
Adults will stumble through the woods on an Easter egg hunt next weekend. Why? For the Boy Scouts.
The Boy Scouts of America Sagamore Council will host the ‚ÄúScouting 4 Eggs Adult Easter Egg Hunt presented by Caterpillar‚Äù at the Franklin L. Cary Camp at 6 p.m. March 23.
It will be the largest adult-only Easter egg hunt in the state, according to a press release from the Boy Scouts of America Sagamore Council.
‚ÄúOver 50,000 eggs and 2,000 prizes to be given out; 70‚Äù LG TV, digital camera, VR, sports tickets/memorabilia, artwork, gift cards, and more amazing prizes from more than 100 local businesses,‚Äù the press release said.
Though the event is adult-oriented and entry is for those 18 and up, no alcohol will be served on the grounds because it is a Boy Scout camp, according to the press release.
‚ÄúThe whole idea behind it is to have it be something that's more based around adult fun,‚Äù said Zachary Danek, a junior in the Polytechnic Institute and the College of Liberal Arts. ‚ÄúEven though (you‚Äôre) not supposed to drink there, it is common for adults to drink a bit before showing up. A lot of parents will get a babysitter for the night and it'll be a nice date evening.‚Äù
Tickets are being sold in advance with preregistration for $25 at
http://scouting4eggs.com.
Shuttles from Faith Church East will begin running at 6 p.m., according to the website. There will be no parking at Cary Camp. Hunting will begin at sunset.
"Please do not arrive just before sunset in case the sunset allows us to start a few minutes early," the website notes.
Shuttles will begin returning hunters to their vehicles about 30 minutes after the start of the hunting.
Included will be live music, a photo booth, Easter-inspired costume contest, Easter Bunny and yard games.
Glow sticks will be on sale, and free s'mores will be available. The campfire rings will be back so bring a lawn chair if you want to sit around a fire.
Take a flashlight and closed-toed shoes.

organizations.name: boy scouts of america sagamore council

author: Daily Excelsior
title: SA crush listless India to win opening Test
text:
CENTURION, Dec 28: Intimidated by pace and scarred by extra bounce, an under-prepared India suffered an embarrassing innings and 32 run loss to a far superior South Africa in the opening Test which ended inside three days here.
Having scored 245 in the first innings, the Indian batters managed only 131 in 34.1 overs in the second innings after South Africa managed a handsome 408 in its first essay.
South Africa thus took an unassailable 1-0 lead in the two-match series and India‚Äôs dreams of winning a Test series in Rainbow Nation for the first time in 31 years lay in tatters.
Only redemption now could be 1-1 draw if they managed to square the series during the New Year‚Äôs Test in Cape Town.
Indian team put up a shoddy batting show, which signified its cluelessness and singular lack of preparedness for a tough assignment like this.
It has been a horrible last six to seven weeks for skipper Rohit Sharma, who lost World Cup final, was removed from Mumbai Indians captaincy two weeks back and now didn‚Äôt look like a leader that made him an instant favourite during the World Cup.
The team also looked a bit like its skipper, dishevelled and without any plan B for course correction.
As Bob Marley‚Äôs iconic ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt worry, Everything Gonna be Alright‚Äù blared from loudspeakers, the Indian team must be wondering how nothing went alright through entire course of the match.
The incomparable Kagiso Rabada (2/32 in 12 overs) along with left-arm seamers Nandre Burger (4/33 in 10) and Marco Jansen (3/36 in 7.1 overs) made the Indian batters hop, skip and jump as the capacity crowd enjoying their Christmas and New Year‚Äôs vacation lapped up every moment of action with great enthusiasm.
The result isn‚Äôt one bit surprising but the manner of abject surrender will certainly haunt Rohit Sharma for the longest time.
Since the Adelaide Test match in 2020-21 when India were all-out for 36, never has an Indian team looked so ill-equipped to handle conditions that was diabolically opposite of what they get in sub-continent.
With India‚Äôs third and fourth pacers leaking runs galore, South Africa managed 408 in the first innings as Indians gave a lovely ‚Äúfarewell present‚Äù to Dean Elgar, who played an uncharacteristically attacking innings of 185 in his penultimate Test.
Even Marco Jansen (84 not out off 147 balls) made merry on a track where fast bowlers would have been licking their lips.
With 163 runs in arrears, there was little chance of survival on a track where the ball was flying around and also jagging a fair bit.
Once Elgar and Jansen batted India out of the match, least one expected was a decent fightback but save Virat Kohli (76), who showed why he is cut above the rest in terms of technique and temperament, others were found wanting.
He was the only one, who could partially conquer the bounce and got his body behind the line to cover the seam movement and also rode the bounce to get his 12 boundaries and a six.
The extra bounce found each and everyone wanting while skipper Rohit was done in by another picture perfect seam-up delivery by Rabada, which compelled the Indian skipper to close his bat face and see the delivery deviate just enough to peg back his off-stump.
Burger, who bowled a bit wide off the crease, consistently bowled back of length, either aiming the rib-cage or keeping at shoulder height outside the off-stump.
Yashasvi Jaiswal couldn‚Äôt sway out of the line, first innings centurion KL Rahul and Ravichandran Ashwin fished at deliveries that bounced extra, while Mohammed Siraj got a bumper that could have knocked his head off.
Ditto for Shardul Thakur, who looked terrified and scared trying to fend a Rabada bouncer, while Shreyas Iyer is certainly not a man for pacey and bouncy conditions.
Earlier veteran Elgar missed out on a well-deserved maiden double hundred but inflicted enough damage on India in company of young Jansen to bat the visitors out of the opening Test.
Elgar, whose previous highest Test score is 199, was inching towards his maiden double hundred before a faint tickle to a leg-side bouncer from Shardul Thakur brought an end to his innings.
But that didn‚Äôt deter the lanky Jansen, not exactly known for his batting prowess, from negotiating a deflated Indian attack that looked out of sorts and bereft of ideas.
The Elgar-Jansen pair added 111 runs for the sixth wicket.
The Indian bowlers were even more disappointing on the third morning with Shardul (1/101 in 19 overs) and Prasidh Krishna (1/93 in 20 overs) spraying all over the place, only to be mercilessly punished by the former Proteas skipper Elgar and Jansen.
The pair drove, pulled, cut at will and neither the old ball nor the semi-new ball could bring about any change in fortune for the visiting team bowlers.
Jasprit Bumrah (4/69 in 26.4 overs) and Mohammed Siraj (2/91 in 24 overs) once again were unlucky as they repeatedly beat the bat of Elgar and Jansen but didn‚Äôt have the rub of the green going their way.
Prasidh and Thakur were not only below-par but also missed both line and length.
Prasidh was inducted into the squad to hit the deck and generate extra pace off the surface, but he missed the trick by consistently bowling length balls. Even someone like Gerald Coetzee dispatched him into the stands.
Prasidh isn‚Äôt ready for Test cricket just like India didn‚Äôt look ready for the series. (PTI)

author: @remoteok
title: Remote Machine Learning Engineer Intern (üí∞~$85k, T√ºbingen) at Meshcapade
text: Hacker News mode Safe for work mode üëâ Hiring for a Remote position?on the üèÜ #1 Remote Jobs board. | | üíµ Salary üé™ Benefits | | üëÄ 51 views ‚úÖ 9 applied (18%) Share this job: Get a [rok.co](https://rok.co/hire-remotely) short link üëâ Please reference you found the job on Remote OK, this helps us get more companies to post here, thanks! When applying for jobs, you should NEVER have to pay to apply. You should also NEVER have to pay to buy equipment which they then pay you back for later. Also never pay for trainings you have to do. Those are scams! NEVER PAY FOR ANYTHING! Posts that link to pages with "how to work online" are also scams. Don't use them or pay for them. Also always verify you're actually talking to the company in the job post and not an imposter. A good idea is to check the domain name for the site/email and see if it's the actual company's main domain name. Scams in remote work are rampant, be careful! [Read more to avoid scams](https://twitter.com/levelsio/status/1300443073562980353?s=20). When clicking on the button to apply above, you will leave Remote OK and go to the job application page for that company outside this site. Remote OK accepts no liability or responsibility as a consequence of any reliance upon information on there (external sites) or here.
